tags.name: nord-avatar

Default avatar illustration is displayed when no src is specified.

tags.name: nord-badge
tags.description:
Badges are used to inform users of the status of an object
or of an action that’s been taken. Commonly used in tabular
data to indicate status.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - The badge content.

Attributes:

  * `type` {`"warning" | "success" | "danger" | "highlight" | "info" | "neutral" | "progress" | undefined`} - The type of badge.
Determines the background color of the badge.

  * `progress` {`"cancelled" | "complete" | "incomplete" | "partially-complete" | undefined`} - The progress of the badge. Displays a progress
indicator next to the label.

Properties:

  * `styles` {`any[]`} - 

  * `type` {`"warning" | "success" | "danger" | "highlight" | "info" | "neutral" | "progress" | undefined`} - The type of badge.
Determines the background color of the badge.

  * `progress` {`"cancelled" | "complete" | "incomplete" | "partially-complete" | undefined`} - The progress of the badge. Displays a progress
indicator next to the label.

tags.name: nord-button
tags.description:
Buttons are used for interface actions. Primary style should be
used only once per section for main call-to-action, while other
styles can appear more frequently.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - The button content

  * `start` {} - Used to place content at the start of button text. Typically used for icons.

  * `end` {} - Used to place content at the end of button text. Typically used for icons.

Attributes:

  * `variant` {`"default" | "danger" | "primary" | "dashed" | "plain" | "switch"`} - The style variant of the button.

  * `type` {`"button" | "submit" | "reset"`} - The type of the button.

  * `size` {`"s" | "m" | "l"`} - The size of the button.
This affects font-size and padding.

  * `aria-expanded` {`"true" | "false" | undefined`} - 

  * `aria-haspopup` {`"true" | "false" | "menu" | "listbox" | "tree" | "grid" | "dialog" | undefined`} - 

  * `href` {`string | undefined`} - When provided, renders the button as a link,
with its href attribute set to the given value.

  * `download` {`boolean`} - When provided together with a href property, the button will
trigger a file download instead of a page visit.

  * `target` {`"_self" | "_blank" | "_parent" | "_top"`} - When provided together with a href property, determines where
to open the linked URL. The keywords have special meanings for
where to load the URL: “_self” means the current browsing context,
“_blank” usually a new tab but users can configure browsers this to
open a new window instead, “_parent” means the parent browsing
context of the current one, but if no parent exists, behaves as
_self, and finally “top” means the topmost browsing context.

  * `expand` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the button expands to fill the width of its container.

  * `loading` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the button is in loading state. Please note that the spinner
is hidden from assistive technologies, so you need to make sure to announce
the loading state to e.g. screen reader users. We also recommend disabling
all user interactions on the button itself while in loading state.

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Makes the component disabled. This prevents users from
being able to interact with the component, and conveys
its inactive state to assistive technologies.

  * `name` {`string | undefined`} - The name of the form component.

  * `value` {`string`} - The value of the form component.

Properties:

  * `defaultSlot` -

“_blank” usually a new tab but users can configure browsers this to
open a new window instead, “_parent” means the parent browsing
context of the current one, but if no parent exists, behaves as

tags.name: nord-calendar
tags.description:
Calendar allows user to pick a date. It comes with built-in
functionality that allows you to set a minimum and a maximum allowed date.
Please note that the date must be passed in ISO-8601 format.

Events:

  * `change` - Dispatched when a date is selected and the value changes.

  * `nord-focus-date` - Dispatched when the calendar's focused date changes.

Attributes:

  * `value` {`string`} - The selected date on the calendar. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

  * `firstDayOfWeek` {`DaysOfWeek`} - Which day is considered first day of the week? `0` for Sunday, `1` for Monday, etc.
Default is Monday.

  * `min` {`string`} - Minimum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the max property.

  * `max` {`string`} - Maximum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the min property.

  * `expand` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the calendar expands to fill the width of its container.

Properties:

  * `styles` {`any[]`} - 

  * `monthSelectNode` {`HTMLElement`} - 

  * `focusedDayNode` {`HTMLButtonElement`} - 

  * `direction` - 

  * `swipe` - 

  * `shortcuts` {`EventListener`} - 

  * `localize` - 

  * `dateFormatShort` {`DateTimeFormat`} - Whilst dateAdapter is used for handling the formatting/parsing dates in the input,
these are used to format dates exclusively for the benefit of screen readers.

We prefer DateTimeFormat over date.toLocaleDateString, as the former has
better performance when formatting large number of dates. See:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleDateString#Performance

  * `monthNames` {`string[]`} - 

  * `monthNamesShort` {`string[]`} - 

  * `dayNames` {`string[]`} - 

  * `dayNamesShort` {`string[]`} - 

  * `value` {`string`} - The selected date on the calendar. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

  * `firstDayOfWeek` {`DaysOfWeek`} - Which day is considered first day of the week? `0` for Sunday, `1` for Monday, etc.
Default is Monday.

  * `min` {`string`} - Minimum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the max property.

  * `max` {`string`} - Maximum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the min property.

  * `expand` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the calendar expands to fill the width of its container.

  * `isDateDisabled` - Controls which days are disabled and therefore disallowed.
For example, this can be used to disallow selection of weekends.

  * `isDateHighlighted` - Controls which days are highlighted with a small indicator.
Returning a "falsy" value will not show an indicator.
Returning "truthy" value will show the indicator, but without an accessible label.
Returning a string will show the indicator, and use the string as accessible label.
It is recommended to return a string rather than a truthy value whenever possible.

  * `activeFocus` {`boolean`} - 

  * `focusedDay` {`Date`} - 

  * `handleDaySelect` - 

  * `handleMonthSelect` - 

  * `handleYearSelect` - 

  * `handleNextMonthClick` - 

  * `handlePreviousMonthClick` - 

  * `enableActiveFocus` - 

  * `disableActiveFocus` -

tags.name: nord-card
tags.description:
Cards are shadowed surfaces that display content and actions on a
single topic. They should be easy to scan for relevant and
actionable information.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - The card content.

  * `header` {} - Optional slot that holds a header for the card.

  * `header-end` {} - Optional slot that positions content at the end of the header. Useful for actions or additional info.

  * `footer` {} - Optional slot that holds footer content for the card.

Attributes:

  * `padding` {`"m" | "l" | "none"`} - Controls the padding of the card component. When set to “none”,
the header and footer slots will still have padding.

Properties:

  * `styles` {`any[]`} - 

  * `headerSlot` - 

  * `headerEndSlot` - 

  * `footerSlot` - 

  * `padding` {`"m" | "l" | "none"`} - Controls the padding of the card component. When set to “none”,
the header and footer slots will still have padding.

tags.name: nord-checkbox
tags.description:
Checkboxes allow user to choose one or more options from a limited set of options.
If you have more than 10 options, please use Select component instead.

Slots:

  * `label` {} - Use when a label requires more than plain text.

  * `hint` {} - Optional slot that holds hint text for the input.

  * `error` {} - Optional slot that holds error text for the input.

Attributes:

  * `indeterminate` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the checkbox is in an indeterminate state.

  * `checked` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the checkbox is checked or not.

  * `size` {`"s" | "m" | "l"`} - The size of the component.

  * `label` {`string`} - Label for the input.

  * `hint` {`string | undefined`} - Optional hint text to be displayed with the input. Alternatively use the hint slot.

  * `hide-label` {`boolean`} - Visually hide the label, but still show it to assistive technologies like screen readers.

  * `placeholder` {`string | undefined`} - Placeholder text to display within the input.

  * `error` {`string | undefined`} - Optional error to be shown with the input. Alternatively use the error slot.

  * `required` {`boolean`} - Determines whether the input is required or not.
An input marked as required will be announced as such to users of assistive technology.
When using this property you need to also set “novalidate” attribute on a form element to prevent browser from displaying its own validation errors.

  * `hide-required` {`boolean`} - Visually hide the required indicator, but still show
required attribute to assistive technologies like screen readers.

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Makes the component disabled. This prevents users from
being able to interact with the component, and conveys
its inactive state to assistive technologies.

  * `name` {`string | undefined`} - The name of the form component.

  * `value` {`string`} - The value of the form component.

tags.name: nord-command-menu
tags.description:
Command Menu allows users to navigate and use an app without
touching the mouse and helps them transform into “power users”
who can harness more advanced features far faster.

Events:

  * `open` {} - The command menu was opened.

  * `close` {} - The command menu was closed.

  * `nord-select` - User selected a command from the menu.

Slots:

  * `footer` {} - Used to replace the default footer contents.

Attributes:

  * `open` {`boolean`} - Show or hide the command menu.

  * `placeholder` {`string`} - Hint text to display in the Command Menu search field.

Please see “Commands data” section for more documentation.

tags.name: nord-date-picker
tags.description:
Date Picker allows user to enter a date either through text input,
or by choosing a date from the calendar. Please note that the date
must be passed in ISO-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

Slots:

  * `label` {} - Use when a label requires more than plain text.

  * `hint` {} - Use when a hint requires more than plain text.

  * `error` {} - Optional slot that holds error text for the input.

Attributes:

  * `open` {`boolean`} - Controls whether date picker dialog is open or not.

  * `min` {`string`} - Minimum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the max property.

  * `max` {`string`} - Maximum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the min property.

  * `direction` {`"left" | "right"`} - This is deprecated, the popout will now adjust automatically based on available space.
Forces the opening direction of the calendar modal to be always left or right.

  * `first-day-of-week` {`DaysOfWeek`} - Which day is considered first day of the week? `0` for Sunday, `1` for Monday, etc.
Default is Monday.

  * `expand` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the date picker expands to fill the width of its container.

  * `size` {`"s" | "m" | "l"`} - The size of the component.

  * `label` {`string`} - Label for the input.

  * `hint` {`string | undefined`} - Optional hint text to be displayed with the input. Alternatively use the hint slot.

  * `hide-label` {`boolean`} - Visually hide the label, but still show it to assistive technologies like screen readers.

  * `placeholder` {`string | undefined`} - Placeholder text to display within the input.

  * `error` {`string | undefined`} - Optional error to be shown with the input. Alternatively use the error slot.

  * `required` {`boolean`} - Determines whether the input is required or not.
An input marked as required will be announced as such to users of assistive technology.
When using this property you need to also set “novalidate” attribute on a form element to prevent browser from displaying its own validation errors.

  * `hide-required` {`boolean`} - Visually hide the required indicator, but still show
required attribute to assistive technologies like screen readers.

  * `readonly` {`boolean`} - Makes the component readonly, so that it is not editable.
Readonly differs from disabled in that readonly fields are still focusable and will be submitted with a form.

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Makes the component disabled. This prevents users from
being able to interact with the component, and conveys
its inactive state to assistive technologies.

  * `name` {`string | undefined`} - The name of the form component.

  * `value` {`string`} - Date value. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

Dropdown menu displays a list of actions or selectable options for
a user. Dropdown uses popout component internally to create
the overlay functionality.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - The dropdown content.

  * `size` {`"s" | "m" | "l"`} - The size of the dropdown. This affects the minimum and maximum inline-size
of the dropdown.

  * `open` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the component is open or not.

  * `align` {`"start" | "end"`} - Set the alignment in relation to the toggle (or anchor) depending on the position.
`start` will align it to the left of the toggle (or anchor).
`end` will align it to the right of the toggle (or anchor).
Setting the `position` to `inline-start` or `inline-end` will switch
`start` and `end` to the top and bottom respectively.

tags.name: nord-layout
tags.description:
Layout component is used to create the main layout of an app. Layout
currently comes with one main configuration: two-column.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - The default main section content.

  * `nav` {} - Used to place content inside the navigation sidebar.

  * `header` {} - Used to place content inside the header section.

  * `drawer` {} - Used to place additional content/details relating to a selected item.

  * `nav-toggle` {} - Used to place a own nav-toggle component, for cases where you might need to add a tooltip.

Attributes:

  * `nav-open` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the navigation is hidden off-screen or not.
Defaults to `true` for wide viewports, and `false` otherwise.

  * `nav-toggle` {`string | undefined`} - ID reference of element used to toggle the navigation.
This is deprecated, the layout component will now render its own nav toggle to simplify usage.

  * `padding` {`"m" | "none"`} - Controls the padding of the default main section slot. When set to “none”,
the nav and header slots will still have padding.

  * `sticky` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the layout's header has sticky positioning.

tags.name: nord-modal
tags.description:
Modal component is used to display content that temporarily blocks interactions
with the main view of an application. Modal should be used sparingly and
only when necessary.

Events:

  * `cancel` {} - Dispatched before the modal has closed when a user attempts to dismiss a modal. Call `preventDefault()` on the event to prevent the modal closing.

  * `close` {} - Dispatched when a modal is closed for any reason.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - Default slot

  * `header` {} - Slot which holds the header of the modal, positioned next to the close button.

  * `footer` {} - Slot which is typically used to hold call to action buttons, but can also be used to build custom footers.

Attributes:

  * `open` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the modal is open or not.

  * `size` {`"s" | "m" | "l"`} - Controls the max-width of the modal when open.

  * `scrollable` {`boolean`} - By default if a modal is too big for the browser window,
the entire modal will scroll. This setting changes that behavior
so that the body of the modal scrolls instead, with the modal
itself remaining fixed.

Properties:

  * `styles` {`any[]`} - 

  * `shadowRootOptions` {`{ delegatesFocus: boolean; mode: ShadowRootMode; slotAssignment?: SlotAssignmentMode | undefined; }`} - 

  * `modal` {`HTMLDivElement`} - 

  * `backdrop` {`HTMLDivElement`} - 

  * `headerSlot` - 

  * `featureSlot` - 

  * `footerSlot` - 

  * `localize` - 

  * `modalController` - 

  * `open` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the modal is open or not.

  * `size` {`"s" | "m" | "l"`} - Controls the max-width of the modal when open.

  * `returnValue` {`string`} - The reason why the modal was closed. This typically indicates
which button the user pressed to close the modal, though any value
can be supplied if the modal is programmatically closed.

  * `scrollable` {`boolean`} - By default if a modal is too big for the browser window,
the entire modal will scroll. This setting changes that behavior
so that the body of the modal scrolls instead, with the modal
itself remaining fixed.

Navigation item populates sidebar navigation with links.
Every item should be placed inside a navigation group.

and marks the item as the current page for assistive technology.

  * `icon` {`string | undefined`} - The name of an icon from Nordicons to display for the nav item.

  * `href` {`string | undefined`} - The url the nav item should link to.
Note: this is not used if you have nested navigation using the "subnav" slot.

  * `badge` {`string | undefined`} - Allows you to add a notification badge with a number next to the nav item.

  * `open` {`boolean`} - When the nav items contains a subnav, controls whether the section is expanded or not.

tags.name: nord-popout
tags.description:
Popouts are small overlays that open on demand. They let users access additional content and actions without cluttering the page.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - The popout content.

Attributes:

  * `id` {`string`} - The id for the active element to reference via aria-controls.

  * `anchor` {`string | undefined`} - Set an optional anchor element to align against, replacing the triggering element.

  * `open` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the component is open or not.

  * `align` {`"start" | "end"`} - Set the alignment in relation to the toggle (or anchor) depending on the position.
`start` will align it to the left of the toggle (or anchor).
`end` will align it to the right of the toggle (or anchor).
Setting the `position` to `inline-start` or `inline-end` will switch
`start` and `end` to the top and bottom respectively.

  * `position` {`"block-end" | "block-start" | "inline-start" | "inline-end"`} - Set the position in relation to the toggle (or anchor).
Options follow logical properties.
`block-start` and `block-end` referring to top and bottom respectively,
`inline-start` and `inline-end` referring to left and right respectively.

tags.name: nord-progress-bar
tags.description:
Progress Bar is used to visually represent the completion
of a task or process. It shows how much of the task has
been completed and how much is still left.

Attributes:

  * `value` {`number | undefined`} - Specifies how much of the task has been completed. Must be a valid floating
point number between 0 and max, or between 0 and 100 if max is omitted. If
there is no value, the progress bar is indeterminate; this indicates that
an activity is ongoing with no indication of how long it’s expected to take.

  * `max` {`number`} - Describes how much work the task indicated by the progress element requires.
The max attribute, if present, must have a value greater than 0 and be a
valid floating point number.

  * `label` {`string`} - Accessible label for the progress indicator. Visually hidden, but shown
for assistive technology.

must be no less than a given value, and no more than another given value.

Slots:

processed. You can customize the size and color of the spinner with the

tags.name: nord-stack
tags.description:
Stack component manages layout of immediate children along the
vertical or horizontal axis with optional spacing between each child.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - The stack content.

Attributes:

  * `gap` {`"s" | "m" | "l" | "xl" | "xxl" | "none"`} - The space injected between components.

  * `direction` {`"vertical" | "horizontal"`} - The direction of the stack.

  * `align-items` {`"start" | "end" | "center" | "stretch" | undefined`} - How to align the child items inside the stack.

  * `responsive` {`boolean`} - This property is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. We recommend using standard [CSS media queries](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Media_Queries/Using_media_queries) over this property. Please see the [updated usage example](/components/stack/?example=using+responsive+media+query).

  * `wrap` {`boolean`} - Defines whether the Stack items are forced in a single line
or can be flowed into multiple lines.

  * `justify-content` {`"start" | "end" | "center" | "baseline" | "space-between" | "space-around" | "space-evenly" | undefined`} - How to justify the child items inside the stack.

Properties:

  * `styles` {`any[]`} - 

  * `gap` {`"s" | "m" | "l" | "xl" | "xxl" | "none"`} - The space injected between components.

  * `direction` {`"vertical" | "horizontal"`} - The direction of the stack.

  * `alignItems` {`"start" | "end" | "center" | "stretch" | undefined`} - How to align the child items inside the stack.

  * `responsive` {`boolean`} - This property is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. We recommend using standard [CSS media queries](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Media_Queries/Using_media_queries) over this property. Please see the [updated usage example](/components/stack/?example=using+responsive+media+query).

  * `wrap` {`boolean`} - Defines whether the Stack items are forced in a single line
or can be flowed into multiple lines.

  * `justifyContent` {`"start" | "end" | "center" | "baseline" | "space-between" | "space-around" | "space-evenly" | undefined`} - How to justify the child items inside the stack.

  * `padding` {`"m" | "l" | "none" | undefined`} - Controls the padding of the tab group component.

tags.name: nord-table
tags.description:
Table is used to organize and display information from a data set.
Provides table styles in addition to features like sticky
headers and support for narrow viewports.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - Default slot which holds the HTML `<table>` element.

Attributes:

Relaxed increases space, condensed reduces space.

  * `scroll-snap` {`boolean`} - Enables scroll-snapping, meaning the scroll position is always column-aligned.

  * `striped` {`boolean`} - Controls whether to use zebra striping on tables, which can improve readability.

tags.name: nord-textarea
tags.description:
Textarea is a component that allows user to write text over
multiple rows. Used when the expected user input is long.
For shorter input, use the Input component.

Slots:

  * `label` {} - Use when a label requires more than plain text.

  * `hint` {} - Optional slot that holds hint text for the textarea.

  * `error` {} - Optional slot that holds error text for the textarea.

Attributes:

  * `resize` {`"vertical" | "auto"`} - Controls whether the textarea is resizable.
By default is manually resizable vertically.
Set to "auto" to enable auto-resizing as content grows.

  * `expand` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the textarea expands to fill the width of its container.

  * `maxlength` {`number | undefined`} - Controls the max allowed length for the textarea.

  * `character-counter` {`boolean`} - Controls whether to show a count of the number of characters in the textarea.
When combined with `maxlength`, both the count and the max length are shown.

tags.name: nord-toast
tags.description:
Toasts are non-disruptive messages that appear in the interface
to provide quick, at-a-glance feedback on the outcome of an action.

Events:

  * `dismiss` {} - Fired when the toast is dismissed (via user action or auto-dismiss), and its exit animation has completed. This event should be used to remove the dismissed toast from the DOM.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - Default slot used for the toast text/message.

Attributes:

  * `variant` {`"default" | "danger"`} - The style variant of the toast.

  * `auto-dismiss` {`number | undefined`} - Timeout in milliseconds before the toast is automatically dismissed.

Properties:

  * `autoDismiss` {`number | undefined`} - Timeout in milliseconds before the toast is automatically dismissed.

tags.name: nord-toggle
tags.description:
Toggle switch gives control over a feature or option that can be
turned on or off. If a physical switch would work for the action, a
toggle is probably the best component to use.

Slots:

  * `label` {} - Use when a label requires more than plain text.

  * `hint` {} - Optional slot that holds hint text for the input.

  * `error` {} - Optional slot that holds error text for the input.

Attributes:

  * `checked` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the toggle is checked or not.

  * `reverse` {`boolean`} - Controls whether the contents are displayed in reverse order,
putting the label before the toggle.

  * `size` {`"s" | "m" | "l"`} - The size of the toggle switch.

  * `label` {`string`} - Label for the input.

  * `hint` {`string | undefined`} - Optional hint text to be displayed with the input. Alternatively use the hint slot.

  * `error` {`string | undefined`} - Optional error to be shown with the input. Alternatively use the error slot.

  * `required` {`boolean`} - Determines whether the input is required or not.
An input marked as required will be announced as such to users of assistive technology.
When using this property you need to also set “novalidate” attribute on a form element to prevent browser from displaying its own validation errors.

  * `hide-required` {`boolean`} - Visually hide the required indicator, but still show
required attribute to assistive technologies like screen readers.

being able to interact with the component, and conveys
its inactive state to assistive technologies.

tags.name: nord-tooltip
tags.description:
Tooltips are floating containers for displaying additional information
for the currently focused element. A tooltip can be useful when you want
to e.g. give a hint about an existing Command Menu shortcut.

Slots:

  * ` ` {} - The tooltip content

  * `shortcut` {} - Optional slot that holds shortcut keys to access the subject

Attributes:

  * `position` {`"block-end" | "block-start" | "inline-start" | "inline-end"`} - Control the position of the tooltip component.
When set to "none", the tooltip will be shown above
but accommodate for browser boundaries.

  * `role` {`string`} - The tooltip role, set on the component by default.

  * `id` {`string`} - The id for the active element to reference via aria-describedby.

  * `delay` {`number`} - The delay in milliseconds before the tooltip is opened.

Properties:

  * `styles` {`any[]`} - 

  * `lastOpened` - 

  * `shortcutSlot` - 

  * `events` - 

  * `currentElement` {`FocusableElement | undefined`} - 

  * `timeoutId` {`number | undefined`} - 

  * `proxy` {`HTMLSpanElement`} - the proxy element is for cases where the targetElement is a web component,
and the WC has a focusable child in its shadow root e.g. a button component.
in this case, when the tooltip is shown, we inject the proxy into targetElement's shadow root
and wire up aria-describedby from the focusable element to the proxy.
when the tooltip is hidden, we remove the proxy and remove the aria-describedby relationship.

  * `state` {`"hidden" | "waiting" | "visible" | "positioning"`} - The current state of the tooltip, dependent on the state machine

  * `coords` {`[number, number]`} - 

  * `position` {`"block-end" | "block-start" | "inline-start" | "inline-end"`} - Control the position of the tooltip component.
When set to "none", the tooltip will be shown above
but accommodate for browser boundaries.

  * `role` {`string`} - The tooltip role, set on the component by default.
